# Roleplay Rule 7 ## Safe Zones: Sanctuary and Conduct
[color=green][bold]Safe Zones[/bold][/color] (Colossus Central, Medical Dispatch, and a 256m radius around each) are neutral sanctuary areas for all players, regardless of group or affiliation.
[color=yellow][bold]Admin Summary:[/bold][/color] - Safe Zones are neutral and protect everyone unless you cause trouble. - Do not steal ID's, ships, or supplies off of ships. - Contraband is only actionable if used or if the contraband holder is causing trouble. - Troublemakers are handed to CO Security Guards, not factions or groups. - Use non-lethal force when practical; lethal force is acceptable if non-lethal would put you or others at serious risk. - Staff may intervene in cases of abuse or unclear situations.
[color=red]Actions within safezones that will result in administrative action:[/color] -- Stealing ID's and/or ship vouchers -- Stealing ships and/or supplies off of them
[color=yellow][bold]Actions that will lead to [color=red]removal[/color] of your safezone protection:[/bold][/color] -- Crimes on the safezone (Trespass, Vandalism of the station) -- Being in safezone radius while having an active [color=red]command[/color] bounty on yourself. -- Being in safezone radius as ghost-role antagonist (Cortical borer, Asakim, Chimera). -- Failure to comply with station head requirements (Overseer for Colossus Central, as an example).
- If you cause trouble in a Safe Zone or it's radius (see above), you [color=yellow]forfeit protection[/color] and may be detained. [color=yellow][bold]Detained individuals must be handed over to CC Security Guards for processing, not to any faction or group.[/bold][/color]
- [color=yellow][bold]Use non-lethal force for arrests and detainment when practical. If non-lethal options would put you or others at serious risk, using lethal force is acceptable.[/bold][/color]
- [color=yellow][bold]Contraband is discouraged in Safe Zones.[/bold][/color] It is only actionable if used or if you are causing trouble. Wearing or carrying immediate gear is tolerated; stashing or distributing is not.
- Entering a Safe Zone does not end ongoing fights or consequences, you [bold]may continue fights[/bold] if it moves into a safezone, while attempting to [bold]minimize[/bold] damage to the safezone.
